intro: Dilkea nitens, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Dilkea nitens is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
